item.description:
The Health Benefits of Tai Chi and Qigong with Alan Krentzel

In December, the members of our group attending Alan's presentation asked him to come back and do more. So, here is your chance to continue if you attended the December presentation, or to participate for the first time, if you were not able to make it.

Are you interested in learning more about the therapeutic benefits of Qigong and T'ai Chi ? Qigong and T'ai Chi are practiced today for numerous health benefits which include reducing stress, promoting balance and flexibility, enhancing the immune system, and easing arthritis pain. Qigong is a Chinese discipline for health maintenance and healing practiced by millions of people for thousands of years. T'ai Chi is a form of Qigong that is more well known in the West due to its martial arts focus. Qigong practices can be classified as healing/medical, spiritual/meditative and martial arts. Qigong and T'ai Chi integrate posture, movement, breathing techniques, and focused intent.
Learn more from Alan Krentzel, a Certified T'ai Chi Instructor with over 18 years experience. Alan is a graduate of the University of Massachusetts Medical School's Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction Practitioner Practicum and is a Professional Member of the National Qigong Association. He also has a Masters in Business Administration.

At the beginning of each meeting, we have a chance to get to know one another and our professional specialties. We share a potluck lunch, and then have a featured presenter share about his/her work.

Please let me know what you'll bring to the potluck when you RSVP.

$10 meeting fee.
item.how_to_find_us: I will welcome you at the front door
item.name: Boston Area Mind-Body Therapies April Meetup: Health Benefits of Tai Chi
